challenges.title: View an Element's CSS
description:
Right-click the Inspect Me! text below and select Inspect. The Elements panel of DevTools opens. The Inspect Me! element is highlighted in the DOM Tree

Inspect Me!



Value of data-message:

In the DOM Tree, find the value of the data-message attribute for the Inspect Me! element.
Change the text in the Data-Message div to reflect this value.
The Styles tab on the Elements panel lists the CSS rules being applied to whatever element is currently selected in the DOM Tree, which should still be the Inspect Me! element in this case. Find the aloha class rule. the factt that you see this rule means that it's being applied to the Inspect Me! element.
The aloha class is declaring a value for padding. Change the text in the Padding-Value div element to reflect this value.

tests.text: Data-Message div element should contain the value of the data-message attribute.
tests.testString: assert(code.match(/.container\s*?{[\s\S]*display\s*?:\s*?grid\s*?;[\s\S]*}/gi), 'container class should have a display property with a value of grid.');

tests.text: Padding-Value div element should contain the padding value assigned to the aloha class.
tests.testString: assert(code.match(/.container\s*?{[\s\S]*display\s*?:\s*?grid\s*?;[\s\S]*}/gi), 'container class should have a display property with a value of grid.');
